dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2012, a Swedish lawyer's request just reopened the investigation into Julian Assange.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty twelve, a Swedish lawyer's request just reopened the investigation into Julian Assange.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The announcement landed Monday, after the lawyer for the alleged victim requested in early April the Swedish Prosecution Authority look into the case again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the one involving those assault allegations from 2009, which he's always denied.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the one involving those assault allegations from two thousand nine, which he's always denied.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange, who denies the rape allegations first made in 2010, has faced numerous legal actions over the last month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now he's actually in a London prison, after spending all that time in the Australian consulate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now he's actually in a London prison, after spending all that time in the Australian consulate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Having spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he'd taken asylum to avoid extradition to Sweden, Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he was sentenced to 30 weeks for bail violation back in May. But this Swedish case is uh, complicating things even more.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he was sentenced to thirty weeks for bail violation back in May. But this Swedish case is uh, complicating things even more.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Having spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he'd taken asylum to avoid extradition to Sweden, Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially with the U.S. extradition request hanging over him too—they've indicted him for conspiracy with Edward Snowden.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially with the U.S. extradition request hanging over him too-they've indicted him for conspiracy with Edward Snowden.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He was also indicted by the U.S. government over an alleged conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack the password of a military computer in order to steal sensitive files.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So Sweden's planning to issue a European arrest warrant, which means the U.K. has to decide who gets him first if there's a conflict.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Sweden's planning to issue a European arrest warrant, which means the U.K. has to decide who gets him first if there's a conflict.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Swedish prosecutor will issue a European arrest warrant. In the event of a conflict between a European arrest warrant and a request for extradition from the U.S., U.K. authorities will decide on the order of priority.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the deputy director of public prosecution, Eva-Marie Persson, she predicted an outcome but didn't say what it would be.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the deputy director of public prosecution, Eva-Marie Persson, she predicted an outcome but didn't say what it would be.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The outcome of this process is impossible to predict, said deputy director of public prosecution Eva-Marie Persson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like they want to interview him in the U.K., but he'd have to cooperate willingly, and given his history…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like they want to interview him in the U.K., but he'd have to cooperate willingly, and given his history...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Persson said investigators will ask for an interview with Assange in the U.K., but noted it would require the Wikileaks founder to cooperate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, he refused to cooperate before, which was one reason they suspended the case back in 2016.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, he refused to cooperate before, which was one reason they suspended the case back in twenty sixteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Swedish prosecutors had initially dropped the case in 2017, after deciding they'd exhausted all possible avenues to properly investigate the allegations. That Assange had refused to cooperate was one significant factor in the case being suspended, the prosecutor's office said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Marianne Ny, the director, did say it could be reactivated if he ever came to Sweden, but now he's already detained.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Marianne Ny, the director, did say it could be reactivated if he ever came to Sweden, but now he's already detained.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But if Julian Assange was to return to Sweden in August 2020, the preliminary investigation could be reopened, director of public prosecution, Marianne Ny, said at the time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So his legal team's probably scrambling—the article mentioned they couldn't be reached for comment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So his legal team's probably scrambling-the article mentioned they couldn't be reached for comment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange's legal team couldn't be reached for comment at the time of publication.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: This is gonna drag on for months, these extradition hearings. Just a huge mess internationally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This is gonna drag on for months, these extradition hearings. Just a huge mess internationally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hearings into his possible extradition to America have begun, but will likely take months to conclude.
